title: Colin York
text:
Colin 'Yic' York (1904–1973) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played for <a href="Yass%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Yass</a> between 1923 and 1926, spent a season with <a href="Queanbeyan">Queanbeyan</a> in 1927 before returning to Yass in 1928 to 1930. He was born in <a href="Yass%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Yass, New South Wales</a>. York primarily played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Prop%20forwards">prop-forward</a> representing Australia in two test matches against Great Britain. York later played with Morpeth in the Newcastle coalfields competition and captain coached Nowra. He later moved to Sydney and became a committee man for the Canterbury RLFC.
York was selected to play for <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20state%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> and <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> in 1928. He continued to represent <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20state%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in 1929 and 1930. In all, York played twice for Australia and six times for NSW.
